intro: Alchornea sidifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alchornea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptic to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Alchornea sidifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
